snippet.textOriginal:
It was an interesting match to watch

snippet.textDisplay:
The difference in this game was the ref right from the off.

Scotland in England's 22. Itoje tries to steal the ball and knocks it on. England pen.

England then score every point following a bad call.

Farrell pen - Cummings not rolling away when he was on top and not in front. Johnny Gray had rolled away. The ball was exposed. CORRECTION, the point were from the next pen. Ruled offside. The back foot when the ball was released was the England player on the ground, and every Scottish player was behind it. AND MORE Fraser Brown was protesting after this, because in the previous ruck Itoje clear pulled him to the ground and held him by the neck. Itoje and Guazerre actually make eye contact. Penalty to Scotland not just not given but recognised and ignored. Its just beggars belief the more I look at it.

Genge try - Kinghorn punished for knock on when Farrell scooped the ball forward into him. Scrum, England scrum goes down before the ball is out, not called, then Hogg has to carry the ball over the line. Leads to try.

Farrell pen - Kinghorn taken out in the air by May diving through his feet. Less than 30 seconds later England pen which in itself was 50/50. England didn't release, Ritchie pulled away when asked, Berghan clears out well and is then penalised immediately, although ref gave it as hands in ruck... who knows why

These are the specific decisions. There are many more, including Sinclair ripping the ball while on the floor right in front of the refs eyes in England's 22, despite what Martin Johnson doing his best to bullshit players were in the refs way.
snippet.textOriginal:
The difference in this game was the ref right from the off. 

Scotland in England's 22. Itoje tries to steal the ball and knocks it on. England pen.

England then score every point following a bad call. 

Farrell pen - Cummings not rolling away when he was on top and not in front. Johnny Gray had rolled away. The ball was exposed. CORRECTION, the point were from the next pen. Ruled offside. The back foot when the ball was released was the England player on the ground, and every Scottish player was behind it. AND MORE Fraser Brown was protesting after this, because in the previous ruck Itoje clear pulled him to the ground and held him by the neck. Itoje and Guazerre actually make eye contact. Penalty to Scotland not just not given but recognised and ignored. Its just beggars belief the more I look at it. 

Genge try - Kinghorn punished for knock on when Farrell scooped the ball forward into him. Scrum, England scrum goes down before the ball is out, not called, then Hogg has to carry the ball over the line. Leads to try. 

Farrell pen - Kinghorn taken out in the air by May diving through his feet. Less than 30 seconds later England pen which in itself was 50/50. England didn't release, Ritchie pulled away when asked, Berghan clears out well and is then penalised immediately, although ref gave it as hands in ruck... who knows why

These are the specific decisions. There are many more, including Sinclair ripping the ball while on the floor right in front of the refs eyes in England's 22, despite what Martin Johnson doing his best to bullshit players were in the refs way.

snippet.textDisplay: Bad weather or not, this has to be the least skillful sport going. Basic catching and throwing, stuff you learn as a child and look at these lot. Ha, incredibly dull, impressively amateur and impossibly intermeable. I see this as a darts/snooker type sport, one you play on a Saturday with your mates then have a few points, the fact they manage to spin it out into a televised event is baffling.

snippet.textDisplay:
Heinz should stick to making baked beans and not kicking rugby balls. Screaming at the TV when he kicked the ball straight into touch from outside his 22.

With the wind advantage in the second half he wasted it for 25 minutes with dreadful kicking, 4 times by him alone in the 3rd quarter, when there was no need to be anywhere near the touchline "JUST KICK IT UP THE MIDDLE OF THE PITCH FFS".

Youngs came on and did just that and 3 of his kicks caused problems including the try. Literally schoolboy stuff that we were taught, for when kicking in windy wet conditions.

snippet.textDisplay: I realise I’m speaking from the perspective of an Englishman but I actually enjoyed the game. The first half was a great battle of tactics and fighting against the deteriorating conditions. The 2nd half was a tense affair, especially after Scotland tied the scores. The balance of the game hung on the slimmest of margins and we just about pipped it. 3rd quarter aside when we continuously kicked it out on the full I thought it was a much better performance from last week.
snippet.textOriginal: I realise I’m speaking from the perspective of an Englishman but I actually enjoyed the game. The first half was a great battle of tactics and fighting against the deteriorating conditions. The 2nd half was a tense affair, especially after Scotland tied the scores. The balance of the game hung on the slimmest of margins and we just about pipped it. 3rd quarter aside when we continuously kicked it out on the full I thought it was a much better performance from last week.

snippet.textDisplay: Apparently Eddie Jones said the he was appalled that there were beer bottles thrown around the stadium at this game.........that  was one of the things reported around the globe from him following this match. Eddie could be reminded that he throws hyperbole around the place with good regularity.......this could be an incentive for others to take exception I guess, but who can beat this little Aussie gnat......he's so distinctive in his exaggerations and fantasies that it's a wonder he's still there. If he attempted a more moderate approach to his England team and their performances then others might take him and the team more seriously.........we'll see.

snippet.textDisplay: Yo también he sido testigo de la histórica rivalidad entre la Selección Inglesa de Rugby (Los XV de la Rosa Roja) y la Selección Escocesa de Rugby (Los XV del Cardo), en la Copa de Calcuta del Torneo de Rugby Guinness de las 6 Naciones. El Campo Murray BT de Edimburgo Escocia, los XV de la Rosa Roja tuvieron una semana amarga contra los Azules 24 a 17 en la 1ra. Ronda. Y los XV del Cardo perdieron lo mismo ante los XV del Trébol 19 a 12. Owen Farrell marca su penalti, para marcar a favor de los Ingleses y Adam Hastings hace lo mismo para el sobrevivido empate. Scrum tras scrum los Ingleses y Escoceses no pudieron ser suficiente fuertes por el poder, en esta rivalidad en la historia del Torneo de Rugby de las 6 Naciones. El Try era para Ellis Genge y Owen Farrell marca la conversión, para la reacción de los XV de la Rosa Roja pero Owen Farrell marca su penalti para marcar y Adam Hastings marco un penalti. La Selección Inglesa de Rugby ya ganaron la Copa de Calcuta en derrotar a los XV del Cardo en un reaccionado resultado. Escocia 6-13✔ Inglaterra. La próxima ronda, será contra la Selección Italiana de Rugby (Los Azzurri) y la Selección Irlandesa de Rugby (Los XV del Trébol). #RickyIsARose #RickyLovesThe6NationsRugby #In6NationsRugbyWeTrust #RickyLovesTheRugby #InRugbyWeTrust #RickyLovesTheRugbyUnion #InRugbyUnionWeTrust #SixNationsRugby #CalcuttaCup🏉.
snippet.textOriginal: Yo también he sido testigo de la histórica rivalidad entre la Selección Inglesa de Rugby (Los XV de la Rosa Roja) y la Selección Escocesa de Rugby (Los XV del Cardo), en la Copa de Calcuta del Torneo de Rugby Guinness de las 6 Naciones. El Campo Murray BT de Edimburgo Escocia, los XV de la Rosa Roja tuvieron una semana amarga contra los Azules 24 a 17 en la 1ra. Ronda. Y los XV del Cardo perdieron lo mismo ante los XV del Trébol 19 a 12. Owen Farrell marca su penalti, para marcar a favor de los Ingleses y Adam Hastings hace lo mismo para el sobrevivido empate. Scrum tras scrum los Ingleses y Escoceses no pudieron ser suficiente fuertes por el poder, en esta rivalidad en la historia del Torneo de Rugby de las 6 Naciones. El Try era para Ellis Genge y Owen Farrell marca la conversión, para la reacción de los XV de la Rosa Roja pero Owen Farrell marca su penalti para marcar y Adam Hastings marco un penalti. La Selección Inglesa de Rugby ya ganaron la Copa de Calcuta en derrotar a los XV del Cardo en un reaccionado resultado. Escocia 6-13✔ Inglaterra. La próxima ronda, será contra la Selección Italiana de Rugby (Los Azzurri) y la Selección Irlandesa de Rugby (Los XV del Trébol). #RickyIsARose #RickyLovesThe6NationsRugby #In6NationsRugbyWeTrust #RickyLovesTheRugby #InRugbyWeTrust #RickyLovesTheRugbyUnion #InRugbyUnionWeTrust #SixNationsRugby #CalcuttaCup🏉.
